messages.subject: unschooling conference
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/21/02 10:39:40 PM Central Daylight Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/21/02 10:39:40 PM Central Daylight Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< << And ds would put in a vote for anything skateboarding or roller
blading. >>

The hotel might not like it a bit, but I'll remind marty to bring blades.
>>

It would be really, really awesome if they could get together at a skate
park. Roller blading is big in our house too. Trevor is wanting to join a new
skate park here with really amazing ramps and jumps.
Ren

messages.subject: unschooling conference
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/21/02 10:39:40 PM Central Daylight Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/21/02 10:39:40 PM Central Daylight Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Thanks for the reply. Dh isn't a group kinda person and his business is
really hoppin' that time of year. >>

Although our business is dieing down that time of year, my dh is also not a
big group person. Being an introvert it drains him. Plus, he's not a big
advocate for unschooling as of yet....homeschooling yes. Unschooling he's
still not sure, he just goes along with me because he knows how passionate I
am.
He's very "outside the box" in a lot of ways though, so I'm not giving up
just yet!!! LOL
Ren

messages.subject: [AlwaysLearning] unschooling conference
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/18/2002 6:11:44 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... I d try the www.unschooling.com site---bunches of wonderful, short essays on unschooling
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/18/2002 6:11:44 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
truealaskans@... writes:


> . If anyone knows of any short articles about unschooling that
> may be helpful, I could probably get him to read something short. Just not
> an entire book. :-) Also, if anyone knows any unschoolers in the Clovis, NM
> area or the Columbus, MS area, perhaps I could get in touch with them. We
> don't have much time left in Clovis, so the Columbus area would be more
> helpful.
>
>

I'd try the www.unschooling.com site---bunches of wonderful, short essays on
unschooling (many written by some of THESE very people talking with you now!<
G>).

As for unschooling conferences, I'm hosting one in Columbia, South Carolina,
11-13 October 2002. Please try to come---and bring your husband! It's
Columbus Day weekend, so you'll have time to travel back home on Monday. Many
of these posters will be there, either as speakers or as attendees. We're
even having a Father's Roundtable, so he can opening discuss his fears with
other DADS who've been there, done that. Access the site at
www.schoolsoutsupport.org No age discrimination either, so bring the kids!

kellyinsc
